subject: Re: [junit] How to test exceptions in java with junit
msgSnippet: ... Agreed, it states your intent more clearly.  I do the same when I voluntarily ignore exceptions: catch(Exception ignore) { // ignore } I just want to make
messageBody:
On 2/24/06, jason r tibbetts <tibbettj@...> wrote:
>
>
> I like to take the catch block one step further and call
> assertTrue(true) (as has been discussed on this list), or, better yet,
> call something like pass(), which I've defined in a base TestCase to do
> just that.


Agreed, it states your intent more clearly. I do the same when I
voluntarily ignore exceptions:

catch(Exception ignore) {
// ignore
}

I just want to make sure that whoever reviews my code knows that I thought
about this possibility.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
